abstract.text: An item containing images, video, and other information that you want to display using a carousel-based interface.

inlineContent.text: object offers a more dynamic way to present your content than section-based items. When a carousel item first appears, it displays either a static image or a short looping video as its background. When the navigation focus stops on the item, the system plays the video in the itemâ€™s
objects and fill them with information about your content. The system determines which properties of the object to display based on the content style. For the
style, the system displays all of the information in your carousel item. For the
style, the system focuses on the actions associated with your item. To specify the actions for both styles, use the inherited

abstract.text: Display content and descriptions, provide channel guides, and support multiple users on Apple TV.
A set of items you present using a carousel-style interface in the top shelf.
An interface that focuses on the actions you want the user to perform.
An interface that displays detailed information about the item.
An item containing images, video, and other information that you want to display using a carousel-based interface.
Constants indicating the itemâ€™s audio and video capabilities.
The URL of a looping video to play, without sound, while the preview loads.
A localized string describing why the item is shown in the top shelf.
The original release date of the content.
The length of the movie or show, in seconds.
The genre assigned to the movie or show.
Information about the media format and presentation options.
Additional information to display for your content, such as a list of leading actors.
The URL for the contentâ€™s trailer or preview.
A descriptive summary of a movie or show.
An item that uses an image to represent a movie, show, or other content in the top shelf.
The action to perform when the user wants to see more information for the current item.
The action to perform when the user wants to play the current item.
An object you use to display additional information.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
